definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: The monarch was ousted by a military coup.
sentences.chinese: 那君主被军事政变者废黜了。

sentences.english: Military coup d'état was a common political phenomenon in the history of African countries.
sentences.chinese: 军事政变是非洲国家历史上广泛经历的一种政治现象。

sentences.english: Coups and counter-coups were followed by the long military rule of Hossain Muhammad Ershad.
sentences.chinese: 然后是军事政变和艾尔沙德将军长期的军事管治。

sentences.english: Mr. Thaksin was ousted in a military coup in 2006.
sentences.chinese: 他信在2006年的一次军事政变中被废黜。

sentences.english: It'a a stunning reversal of fortune after last year's military coup.
sentences.chinese: 这是去年军事政变后出现的惊人的时来运转。

definition: Suharto (1921-2008), former Indonesian general, president of the Republic of Indonesia 1967-1998
Syngman Rhee (1875-1965), US trained Korean politician and dictator, president of Republic of Korea 1948-1960
Chun Doo Hwan (1931-), South Korean politician, president 1980-1988
Erdogan (name)/Recep Tayyip Erdoğan (1954-), Turkish politician, prime minister from 2003
Robert Mugabe (1924-), Zimbabwean ZANU-PF politician, president of Zimbabwe 1987-2017
